pr_title: Fix merging of terms aggregation with compound order

timeline.message:
Fix merging of terms aggregation with compound order

This change fixes a bug introduced in #61779 that uses a compound order to
compare buckets when merging. The bug is triggered when the compound order
uses a primary sort ordered by key (asc or desc).
This commit ensures that we always extract the primary sort when comparing keys
during merging.
The PR is marked as no-issue since the bug has not been released in any official version.

timeline.bodyText: Can dict be a local variable?
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: I want to ensure that there are some equal keys in the instances that we try to merge so I build a single dictionary for the entire test suite. It could be easier if the class was not used by the AggregationTests.
replies.author: jimczi

timeline.message: refactor tests to use a local variable
